intro: Ilex grisebachii var. nipensis, commonly known as the Japanese holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to Japan and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, glossy leaves. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardiness. Ilex grisebachii var. nipensis typically grows in shaded to partially sunny conditions and thrives in well-drained soil.
